title: Unit 2 Checkpoint: Triangle Foundations
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of triangle classification (by sides and angles), Triangle Angle Sum Theorem, Exterior Angle Theorem, isosceles/equilateral triangle properties, and the Triangle Inequality Theorem including range problems.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: By sides (scalene/isosceles/equilateral), by angles (acute/right/obtuse), dual classification
Sum of interior angles = 180°, finding missing angles algebraically, isosceles base angle theorem
Exterior angle = sum of two remote interior angles, connection to angle sum theorem, algebraic setup
Sum of two shortest > longest, finding range |a-b| < x < a+b, strict inequality

assessmentProblems.question: Classify each triangle by sides and angles (dual classification): (a) sides 5, 5, 5 with all 60° angles, (b) sides 3, 4, 5 with a 90° angle, (c) sides 6, 6, 10 with an obtuse angle.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) Equilateral equiangular (all sides equal, all angles 60°). (b) Right scalene (one 90° angle, no equal sides). (c) Obtuse isosceles (one angle > 90°, two equal sides).

assessmentProblems.question: In triangle DEF, angle D = 63° and angle E = 48°. Find angle F.
The angles of a triangle are (5x - 2)°, (3x + 8)°, and (2x + 14)°. Find x and all three angle measures. Classify the triangle.
An isosceles triangle has base angles of (3x + 10)° each and a vertex angle of (4x - 20)°. Find x and all angle measures.
An exterior angle of a triangle measures 135°. One remote interior angle is 70°. Find the other remote interior angle and the interior angle adjacent to the exterior angle.
assessmentProblems.answer: Exterior = sum of remotes: 135 = 70 + x → x = 65°. Adjacent interior: 180 - 135 = 45°. Check angle sum: 70 + 65 + 45 = 180 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: An exterior angle of a triangle is (7x + 5)°. The two remote interior angles are (3x + 15)° and (2x + 20)°. Find x and all angle measures.
Which sets of lengths can form a triangle? (a) 4, 7, 12  (b) 5, 8, 11  (c) 3, 3, 6  (d) 9, 9, 1
Two sides of a triangle are 7 and 18. What is the range of possible values for the third side?
An equilateral triangle has a perimeter of 36. One of its exterior angles is measured. Find: (a) the side length, (b) each interior angle, (c) each exterior angle.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) Side = 36/3 = 12. (b) Each interior angle = 60° (equilateral → equiangular). (c) Each exterior angle = 180 - 60 = 120°.

assessmentProblems.question: ANALYSIS: In triangle PQR, angle P = (x + 10)° and angle Q = (2x - 5)°. The exterior angle at R is (4x - 15)°. Find x, all interior angles, and verify using both the Exterior Angle Theorem and the Triangle Angle Sum Theorem.
assessmentProblems.answer: Exterior Angle Theorem: ext at R = P + Q → 4x-15 = (x+10)+(2x-5) = 3x+5 → x=20. P=30°, Q=35°. Ext at R=65°. Interior R=180-65=115°. Verify angle sum: 30+35+115=180 ✓. Verify ext: 30+35=65 ✓. Classification: obtuse triangle (R=115°>90°).

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Angle Pairs): Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. Same-side interior angles measure (3x + 20)° and (7x)°. Find x and both angle measures.
spiralReview.answer: Same-side interior are supplementary: (3x+20)+(7x)=180 → 10x+20=180 → 10x=160 → x=16. Angles: 3(16)+20=68° and 7(16)=112°. Check: 68+112=180 ✓.

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Angle Pairs): Two angles are complementary. One is 5 times the other. Find both.

answerKeys.gcu2-1: (a) equilateral equiangular (b) right scalene (c) obtuse isosceles.
answerKeys.gcu2-10: x=20. P=30°, Q=35°, R=115°. Obtuse triangle.
